intro: Cleistanthus boivinianus f. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
